intro: Atylus cuneatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Atylus cuneatus is often found in open woodlands and along coastal areas.
